data.title: Upgrade Electron to v1.6.x
data.body:
### Reported Issues

* [x] Object undefined errors from Electron https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-261263408 and https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-261527755
* [x] Default CSP changed, breaking file-icons and specs
* [x] `os.tmpDir()` deprecation warnings https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-288871751
* [x] Drag image in `tree-view` incorrect (https://github.com/atom/tree-view/pull/1054)
* [x] Drop marker on `tabs` and `tree-view` missing (https://github.com/atom/tree-view/pull/1055, https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/426)
* [x] Changes from https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13795 cause exceptions in minimap (https://github.com/atom-minimap/minimap/pull/582)
* [x] Dragging pane items between docks mistakenly shows drop indicators due to new security constraints for the `dragover` event `dataTransfer` object (https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/437)
* [x] Developer tools stop updating after reloading a window in dev mode
* [x] Issues folding soft-wrapped lines https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-301161445
* [x] Dev tools reload exception (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-301207979, filed a bug for this in https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9493)
* [x] Dev tools reload crash (end of https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-301207979, filed a bug for this in https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9493)
* [ ] White flash when hiding toolbar https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-301182375
* [ ] Warnings from tree-view https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-301208739
* [ ] Consistently crashing when continuing from a devtools breakpoint (filed a bug for this in https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9078)

Reported issues resolved by #13880:

* [x] Scrollbars misbehaving on first file that is opened/restored https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12696#issuecomment-251299649
* [x] Shift-scrolling scrolls vertically instead
* [x] Failing `spec/text-editor-component-spec.js` tests

---

During my initial testing on macOS 10.12, this seems to be working. Haven't noticed any regressions.
Would be great if more folks could give this a spin ðŸ™‡

/cc @atom/maintainers 

---

Fixes #11692 
Resolves #12690
Fixes #8006
Fixes #12832 
Fixes #13767 
Fixes #4084 (Will be fixed by the editor rendering rewrite)
Fixes #13265 (Will be fixed by the editor rendering rewrite)

data.title: Simplify Windows build instructions
data.body: Take two!

data.title: Avoid adding non-existent project directories
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10297
Depends on https://github.com/atom/service-hub/pull/9

/cc @peterhal @nmote @mostafaeweda

This implements the plan we described in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10297#issuecomment-245997900. This means that Nuclide's `atom.directory-provider` service hook will be called earlier in Atom's startup process, before project deserialization and notably before Nuclide's `activate` method is called. It also means that custom `Directory` instances for which `.existsSync()` returns `false` will _not_ be added to the project, so you may need to handle the state where the user has not yet authenticated specially in that method.

Also note that the `atom.directory-provider` service must be specified in Nuclide's top-level package.json (rather than being registered dynamically) in order to be recognized.

Sorry for requiring you to make these changes, but we really need to fix #10297, which was introduced by changes that we made together in order to accommodate Nuclide in the first place, so it doesn't seem too unreasonable.

data.title: Suggestion: Use webpack to reduce `require` calls
data.body: Using webpack can significantly reduce the number of require calls during startup time. Are there any plans for it?

data.title: Split screen horizontal / floating windows
data.body:
1. While working in photoshop I use the window mode (all elements float on screen and can be ordered as you prefer). 
2. While using portrait screen. In other code editors I place the document tree on top half of screen and editor underneath.

Does or is there any request scheduled to achieve similar result, or does it exist?

data.title: Atom CLI triggers OS X Sierra native tabs
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When opening a second atom window from the CLI it triggers OS X Sierra native tabs in some case(s?). I could reproduce this in safe mode and after a factory-defaults reset.

This may or may not be an Electron issue though I could not produce it in another Electron app.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. have a 2 monitor setup
2. open terminal (iTerm in my case) full screen on monitor 2
3. in terminal `cd` to any project
4. in terminal `atom .`
5. atom opens on monitor 1 (**instance 1**)
6. put **instance 1** in OS X fullscreen mode if it is not and keep it in foreground on monitor 1
7. in terminal `cd` to any other project
8. in terminal `atom .`

**Expected behavior:** Atom opens **instance 2** in a second window (fullscreen optional)

**Actual behavior:** **instance 2** opens in a native tab

![atom-native-tabs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/38758/18503304/7d5b6e40-7a5c-11e6-9ae4-f7ae56d8eb23.png)

**Work-around:** in step 6, make sure atom is nowhere in foreground

**Notes:** AFAIK issue could not be produced with one monitor, considering you need atom in fullscreen foreground to trigger this issue. If you have a terminal that can overlay your fullscreen Atom I'm guessing you can also produce this issue.
### Versions

macOS Sierra 10.12 GM

```
Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

data.title: Upgrade Electron to v1.3.6
data.body:
This might need some manual testing. Judging by the [changelog](https://github.com/electron/electron/releases/tag/v1.3.6) I don't expect this to cause any issues, but it doesn't hurt to be extra careful.

/cc @atom/feedback

data.title: doctype crash on HTML or PHP
data.body:
Hello guys, 
When i use this combination of doctype and PHP:

`<?PHP

?>
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN"  "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xml:lang="en-US" lang="en-US">`

And try to edit or change something in the first lines, ATOM crash ... i try to replicate this error on safe-mode but not happend there, 
I think the problem is the string on the DOCTYPE tag.

i use lastest version ATOM

thx

data.title: Panel closes with certain searches
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode]
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom]?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide]?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When using some regex patterns, trying to type in the replace box closes the panel on every keystroke.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the find and replace all panel
2. Make sure regex is selected
3. Enter this as the search pattern: `([^ ])\/>`
4. In the replace box, start typing. The text I was using was: `$1 />`

**Expected behavior:** 

The panel does not close and lets me finish typing

**Actual behavior:**

The panel closes on every keystroke
### Versions

Mac OSX 10.11.6
Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.9.3

data.title: Unable to override alt-shift-s
data.body:
Just installed Atom. First thing I am doing is changing the keymaps.
I did:

'body':
  'alt-shift-S': 'core:save-as'

but whenever I press alt-shift-s I get the snippets popup. So I did:

'.available-snippets atom-text-editor[mini]':
  'ctrl-alt-S': 'snippets:available'

and yet I still get the stupid snippets popup when I press alt-shift-s.

What do I have to do to override this keybind?? It should not be this difficult.  My custom keybind should automatically override any other default keybind..

data.title: Unable to set keymap for core:save-all
data.body:
The documentation for Atom is horrendous. It should not be this difficult to set a simply keymap. All I want is to set the save all to ctrl-alt-s. 

Here is what I did in keymap.cson:

'atom-text-editor':
  'ctrl-shift-s': 'core:save-all'
  'ctrl-alt-s': 'core:save-as'

Now, the save-as works (thought I had tried alt+shift+s which did NOT work) but the save-all will not work at all. 

Please document how to set up keymaps and please provide documentation for all the classes for all the menu commands. This should be easy, as it is with Brackets and VSCode - both let me set the key bindings is mere seconds and setting a key bind always overrides a default - not so with Atom apparently.

data.title: Settings menu not loading appropriately when right-clicking a file
data.body:
I'm getting a misbehavior of the 'Settings' menu (via 'File' > 'Settings'). If I open atom via the command line (either 'atom' or 'atom --safe'), and open a file from the 'Open' option, everything works fine.

However, if I open the same file in Windows by right-clicking the file and selecting 'Open with atom' (launching a new instance of atom), when I go to the 'settings' menu and select 'Packages', 'Themes', or 'Updates', the system is unable to load any information about installed packages, etc.

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21962654/18478619/d02c8980-79c9-11e6-9311-2f79c141c04c.png)

However, inside the 'Settings' menu, the information still appears for the submenus 'Settings' and 'Keybindings'.

I deactivated all non-core packages to see if this solved the problem - it didn't.

Some info about my system:

*OS: Windows 10, home edition, build 10.0.10586

*atom --version output:
Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
- apm --version output:
  apm  1.12.5
  npm  3.10.5
  node 4.4.5
  python 3.5.1
  git 2.9.3.windows.3
  visual studio

data.title: Wrong event.keyCode on keydown event for Korean/Japanese input
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom does not detects a correct `keyCode` of keydown event for Korean and Japanese keyboard input.
(when user input is set to **Hangul** (Korean) or **Anthy** (Japanese) keyboard input).

Any other standard keyboard layout input gives desired key code (`q = 81`, etc.), but these input modes always posting **229** as event `keyCode`. This is Atom event subscriber I use:

``` javascript
editorView.addEventListener('keydown', (event) => {
    console.log(event.keyCode);
});
```

And it works perfect for other keyboard layouts.

Native JS in HTML test page (out of Atom):

``` javascript
document.onkeydown = function(event) {
    console.log(event.keyCode);
};
```

In Chrome browser it gives the correct `keyCode` even for Korean and Japanese input. So issue is Atom-specific.

**Expected behavior:** `keyCode` for `keydown` event on `q` should be equal to **81** (example).

**Actual behavior:** `keyCode` for `keydown` event on `q` equals to **229** (like any other keys).
### Versions

Atom 1.10.0
Ubuntu 16.04 x64

data.title: Add File > Open Recent menu item
Add auto indent keyboard shortcut
Antivirus flags "pathwatcher.node" as trojan malware
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode]?
  Yes
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom]?
  Yes. Downloaded Atom a few minutes ago. Version 1.10.2
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide]?
  Yes
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss]?
  Yes
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository]?
  I think so.
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search] to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
  Yes.
### Description

On starting Atom and on performing certain actions like searching for new packages or even just opening the package manager, my antivirus (360 total security) reports that a trojan has been detected. 

After adding the patchwatcher.node file to my antivirus whitelist and restarting Atom, the problem went away. I think it might be worth looking into, though.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. If you have 360 total security installed, launch Atom
2. If you haven't already seen the alert, try to install a new package from the package manager

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
When I search for a package, I expect to see results.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
A trojan alert is displayed by my antivirus and I do not see my search results afterwards.
### Versions

Atom 1.10.2
Windows 10 Pro x64

data.title: Syntax highlighting without file extension

### Description

When I open a file without file extension I have no syntax highlighting at all.
### Steps to Reproduce

2. open it
3. rename file to .xml
4. open it

**Expected behavior:**
If no file extension available atom could check the content of the file (maybe just the first line) to choose the correct syntax highlighting.

**Actual behavior:**
no file extension = no highlighting
### Versions

Atom    : 1.10.0
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
Windows 7 64-Bit

data.title: Cursor in unexpected position when moving it while selecting
data.body:
Observed in Atom 1.10.2 on Windows 10 Home using Atom One UI Theme and Atom Light syntax theme.
1. Create a new file and enter some lines of text in it. Make sure there are around 40 characters per line.
2. Position your cursor somewhere halfway the second line (say, column 20)
3. Hold Shift and move the cursor up one line using the arrow Up key
4. Observe: The cursor is in the expected position, line 1 column 20, exactly one column above where it was before, and text from where the cursor is now up to where it was before is now selected
5. Release the Shift key
6. Press the Up key on the keyboard
7. Observe: The text is no longer selected (expected)
8. Observe: The cursor is now at the beginning of the line (column 1) (**not** expected)
9. Press the Down key on the keyboard
10. Observe: The cursor is now on line 2, column 1.

Expected behavior: Since we started on line 2 and are on line 1 at step 6, it's not possible to go up one more line so I would expect the cursor to remain where it is. I do expect to lose the selection when I attempt to move the cursor, but I don't expect it to move to the beginning of the line. 

The problem with the current behavior is that when you do Up, Down, you don't return to where you were before. This gives unexpected cursor 'jumps' when editing.

I compared with Microsoft Notepad and Notepad++

**MS Notepad:**
Behaves as I would expect. The cursor remains at it's position when we press Up on line 1, selection is lost

**Notepad++**
Has some mysterious behavior of itself. It also moves the cursor to column 1 when we press up (like Atom), but, crucially, when we press Down it moves the cursor back to where it was. This is actually also unexpected

I guess it's a minor issue. But I've found myself selecting the wrong stuff / deleting the wrong parts of a line etc when editing from muscle memory and I've traced it back to this quirk. I think it would improve the editing experience if it was fixed.

Also, note that if we don't hold Shift when moving Up and Down, Atom behaves as Notepad++:
When we press Up while the cursor is on line 1, it visually moves to the beginning of the line, however if we then press Down it actually moves back to where it was before, therefore maintaining command symmetry. This behavior changes (for the worse imho) when we hold Shift to select some text.

data.title: Don't include destroyed panes in result of PaneContainer.getPanes() after PaneContainer is destroyed
data.body:
This is a failing test to illustrate a bug in `getPanes()`. I'm not sure what the right fix for this is ðŸ˜ž

Here's the problem as I understand it now: when you call `PaneContainer::destroy()`, it destroys all of its Panes. Each Pane will notify its PaneAxis, which will then remove the Pane from its list of children. This all works as long as the container's root is a PaneAxis, however, when you go from 2 to 1 Panes, the PaneAxis will reparent the last Pane making it the container's root. From that point on, `PaneContainer::getPanes()` will delegate to [the (destroyed) Pane](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/v1.11.0-beta5/src/pane.coffee), which returns a list that includes itself.

My gut says that the right way to address this is to never have a Pane be the root (e.g. always contain it in a PaneAxis) but I don't really know.

data.title: Ensure pane is added to container before invoking onDidAddPane listeners
data.body: Fixes #12654

data.title: Don't wait for spec windows to save state
data.body:
Since spec windows don't register handlers for the IPC messages requested window state to be saved, the promise never resolves and the close button needs to be clicked twice. To avoid this, we'll just resolve the promise immediately in a spec window so we can proceed to close it.

Closes #12664
